isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SPICER 15-1/2 INCH (394 MM) SOLO™ CLUTCH - INSTALL - RESETTING PROCEDURE

svcproc.title: RESETTING PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: This procedure is for clutch assemblies that are being re-installed and were removed without following the correct REMOVAL PROCEDURE.

step1.para: Remove the 4 shipping bolts if they have been installed.

Support the clutch cover assembly in an arbor press with the release bearing facing down. Allow enough clearance below the clutch cover assembly for release bearing movement and access to install the 4 shipping bolts ( Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Allow Clearance Below Clutch Cover Assembly

step1.para: Press on the retainer until it stops ( Figure 25). Lock the press in this position.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Press on Retainer Until It Stops

step1.para: Slide the wear indicating tab to the new position. Hold the tab in this position ( Figure 26).
Install (4) 7/16 x 14 x 1 3/4 UNC hex head bolts in the holes provided in the clutch cover and into the pressure plate. Turn them finger tight.

note.para: Slightly longer bolts may be needed temporarily to allow access for the 1-3/4 bolts.

step1.para: Progressively tighten the 4 bolts in a crisscross pattern until the face of the pressure plate is 1.75 to 1.78 inch below the clutch cover mounting surface ( Figure 27).

svcproc.para: The clutch can now be installed following the procedure under CLUTCH ASSEMBLY.
